info.headline: Dust Advisory issued April 18 at 9:44PM MST until April 18 at 10:30PM MST by NWS Tucson AZ
info.description:
The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a
* Dust Advisory for... Northeastern Pima County in southeastern Arizona... South central Pinal County in southeastern Arizona...
* Until 1030 PM MST.
* At 943 PM MST, a dust channel was over Avra Valley, or 13 miles west of Marana, moving southeast at 25 mph.
HAZARD...Less than one half mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph.
SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists.
IMPACT...Hazardous travel.
* This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 229 and 269. Interstate 19 between mile markers 54 and 63. Route 77 between mile markers 70 and 86. Route 79 between mile markers 96 and 100. Route 86 between mile markers 127 and 171. Route 286 between mile markers 37 and 45.
Locations impacted include... Tortolita, Rincon, Oro Valley, Tucson, San Luis - Sells District, Pascua Pueblo Yaqui Reservation, Dove Mountain, Davis-Monthan Air Force Base, Pan Tak, South Tucson, Tucson Estates, Saguaro National Park West, Avra Valley, Sil Nakya, Silver Bell, Valencia West, San Isidro, Pinal Airpark, Cababi, and Ryan AirField.
info.instruction:
Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
